Christmas Packages!

I received two Christmas packages today! One came from my family and one came from my church in Seattle. The packages contained lots of goodies:
  • Butterfingers & Reese's Peanut Butter Cups (two of my favorite candies...I love peanut butter!)
  • Beef Jerky
  • My sister-in-law's amazing pistachio bread (Thanks Leah!! You know how much I love your pistachio bread!)
  • Hot Chocolate packs
  • A box of cereal
  • Crackers and Cheese
  • Some peanut butter wafer cookies
  • Time "The Year in Review" magazine
  • A couple of movies
Thanks for those who sent packages. Anyone else who wants to send me a package is welcome to :).

Anyhow, we're having a Christmas party here in about 30 minutes with the other ELT Edge teachers. Should be a good time. We're having another one on Christmas day with the other foreign teachers here at QFPLC.

Merry Christmas!

About

Well, I'm back in Qinhuangdao from Hong Kong and Taiwan. My time in Hong Kong and Taiwan was enjoyable, but not very eventful. I've got more about my time in China that I plan to blog about, but recently I've focused all my computer time on finishing a project that I'll be putting on my resume for when I apply for jobs. So blogging just isn't a priority right now.

The Olympics don't officially start until tomorrow night, but some of the events have already began. I went to the USA vs. Norway women's soccer game last night. Unfortunately, we lost 2-0, but it was fun to go. I'll be going to 3 different events in Beijing before flying home in 6 days!
